The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16224](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16224.html) (gui: Bilingual GUI error messages by hebast
Thanks for the reviews so far. Have addressed feedback from @ryanofsky, @promag.
Code review ACK d5ec57c, modulo (documentation) rebase.

ACK 3cf36736e540cf06250701f0934a7946836d000d

In commit "refactoring: move ReplayBlocks under CChainState" (70e969495191a89070a1308393a5749b37b11e8d)\n\nShould maybe use ChainstateActive instead of g_chainstate to be consistent with surrounding code
ab350cabd5e078ce09378258e35d6051a2d2d3ce\n\nMaybe move&merge this comment with the one in the header?

Hah yeah, I guess we have yet to formalize anything around this but I prefer prefixing method calls with `this->` for clarity. See [the related IRC discussion](http://www.erisian.com.au/bitcoin-core-dev/log-2019-05-06.html#l-572).
This is taken care of in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16757 so I won't duplicate effort here.

re: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16743#discussion_r319456959\n\nAt some point I tried to allow `lowerCase()` for object methods as way to distinguish calls that use the current object from calls that don't (#14635), but agree that `this->` helps without that option.
